short_definition: A direction of the court in some matter incidental to the main proceeding which adjudicates a preliminary point or directs some step in the proceeding; a direction that the court gives to the parties of a dispute commanding them to do or not to do a given act.
long_definition_html: A direction of the court in some matter incidental to the main proceeding which adjudicates a preliminary point or directs some step in the proceeding; a direction that the court gives to the parties of a dispute commanding them to do or not to do a given act.
long_definition_markdown: A direction of the court in some matter incidental to the main proceeding which adjudicates a preliminary point or directs some step in the proceeding; a direction that the court gives to the parties of a dispute commanding them to do or not to do a given act.
long_definition_text: A direction of the court in some matter incidental to the main proceeding which adjudicates a preliminary point or directs some step in the proceeding; a direction that the court gives to the parties of a dispute commanding them to do or not to do a given act.
